title: How many people get fined for having no TV licence? - Quora
tags: Television Licence in the United Kingdom

response.answer_text: About 113,000 last year. It is important to note that almost all of them were under £200 and many were less than £250 despite the dire warnings of £1000 fines. Additionally, with very few exceptions, the fines are issued to those who answer their door to TV Licensing ‘inspectors’, admit to watching without a licence AND sign the paperwork known as a TVL178, or ‘confession form’ TV Licence ‘inspectors’ have no powers whatsoever and they cannot enter your home without your consent (they can get a warrant, but this is extremely rare). If you get a visit from TV Licensing staff, you are strongly advised to SAY nothing, SIGN nothing and SHUT your door. This applies whether or not you actually do need a licence, as there have been cases where innocent householders have been taken to court where the documents were falsified.
